availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Crutcher Ireland (Greenup County attorney and politician; Assistant Clerk for the Senate)

body.p: Greenup County, Kentucky attorney and politician. Mason County, Kentucky native. Son of Samuel D. Ireland and Sarah Crutcher Ireland. Attended school in Mason County and Lewis County. Clerked in a Maysville, Kentucky store. Studied law in Clarksburg, Kentucky from 1845 to 1848. Married Pamelia D. Robb Ireland in 1848. Father of Virginia L. Ireland, and Sallie D. Ireland. Admitted to the bar in Lewis County, Kentucky in 1848. Began legal practice in Greenup County, Kentucky in 1852. Served in the House of Representatives of the Kentucky General Assembly from 1859 to 1863. Served as Assistant Clerk for the Senate of the Kentucky General Assembly from 1863 to 1865.

bibl.p: The Biographical Encyclopædia of Kentucky of the Dead and Living Men of the Nineteenth Century, vol. 1 (Cincinnati, OH: J. M. Armstrong and Co., 1878), p. 500, 503. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lewis County, District 1, p. 240. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Greenup County, East Little Sandy, Subdistrict 2, p. 2. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boyd County, Ashland, p. 33. “Judge William Crutcher Ireland (1823-1894),” Find A Grave, memorial no. 74205273, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=74205273&ref=acom (accessed June 15, 2017).
